article: During my last year of junior high school, our teacher, Mrs Debby, gave us a  _  . I was a hard-working student and I did well in all subjects. I was  _  that I had nailed this test and breezed through the questions  _  I read the last one: 'What is the  _  name of the woman who cleans the school?' Of course I thought that  _  have been a joke. I saw the cleaning woman every day. She was short and about 50 years old. She had dark hair. But  _  would I know her name? I had never talked with her before. In fact, I'd never  _  thought about talking to her. I looked at my paper and started to feel rather  _  . Finally, I handed in my paper, leaving the last one  _  . Before the quiz ended, one student asked if the last question would be  _  in our grades. "Of course," the teacher said, "In your life, you will meet many people. They are all  _  . They deserve your attention and care, even if all you do is to  _  and say hello." I've never  _  that lesson. Everyone deserves my  _  and I should get to know all of the people  _  work and live around me. That is, perhaps, the most important lesson of my life.
